Activities.Body:
Follow up from #289

**NOTE:** This is it for now, I need to think a bit on some of the other dashboards on how best to represent company involvement.

---

## Problem 3 - Companies cannot reasonably measure their involvement

**Feature Request:** On dashboards where `repo_group` is present, allow further filtering by Company.

As a company trying to gauge our involvement within a particular SIG or subproject, we cannot establish what areas we are contributing to because `repo_group` does not provide enough detail (the previous two requests).

Being able to look at the areas, and check company investment helps highlight areas that need potential headcount, or internal re-alignment to ensure the upstream group/repo/subproject remains healthy.

(No examples, please see above requests examples, but think of company metric)


[kubernetes/kubernetes]: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes
[kubernetes/enhancements]: https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements

---

## Dashboards

- Community Sizing and Health Assessment Dashboards
  - GitHub Stats by Repository
  - GitHub Stats by Repository Groups

Issue.Title: [feature request][kubernetes] Add Company filter for the following charts

Activities.Body:
Please add `[feature request]` to the issue title when requesting new features, dashboards, projects etc.
Please add `[bug]` to the issue title when reporting a bug.

Is there a way you can add company contribution totals to data like this? https://k8s.devstats.cncf.io/d/66/developer-activity-counts-by-companies?orgId=1&from=1447338914018&to=1605191714018&var-period_name=v1.19.0%20-%20v1.20.0&var-metric=contributions&var-repogroup_name=All&var-country_name=All&var-companies=VMware%20Inc.&var-companies=Pivotal

either at the top or at the bottom. The idea would be to compare different companies totals together and see which company is contributing more or less?

Also, is there a metric to traffic contributions of companies between each release? i.e. 1.19 vs 1.20 data to see increase vs decreases

Issue.Title: [Feature Request]

Activities.Body:
## Description
The current graphs have a static set of values for the range drop down. It would be valuable to be able to define a custom range eg( start date to end date ) or if more granular data (monthly for the last year) that would be very helpful.

## Motivation
I'd like to generate monthly stats and aggregate them across custom 3 month periods and the current range values wouldn't be able to generate such data.

Issue.Title: [feature request] More granular range values for contribution chart

https://prestodb.devstats.prestodb.io/d/16/opened-to-merged?orgId=1

The reasoning is, we want to make sure all community contributors have a good, fast time to merge, and to help understand this it would be useful to filter by company.

Activities.Body:
Today the dashboard is showing contributions of people to CNCF related repos.

It would be nice to get a more fine grained understanding of where contributions are landing.
Assuming a repository that has a "core", "automation", "test", and "utilities", then it would be nice if there are graphs that classify contributions on these (repo defined) classes.

This would be nice to have on a repo level, but can then probably also be scaled to a org level.

This could work by having a file with a mapping from file patterns (like i.e. gitignore) to classes.

User story: As a project owner I'd like to track which areas of my project get contributions.

Issue.Title: [feature request] Classifying contributions

I'm not familiar with how this project is setup, but my initial guess is that on line https://github.com/cncf/devstats/blob/master/backstage/psql.sh#L16 `spotify/backstage` should be `backstage/backstage`. Although, leaving this on experts to review!

Issue.Title: [bug] Tekton stats suddenly stop in May (CDF devstats)

Activities.Body:
## Problem

DevStats currently does not provide enough granular signal on many of the dashboards to make meaningful inferences from the data. This is largely because `repo_group` is not a good mapping to a particular SIG, and does not provide insight into the subprojects that are repo specific or reflect the work that occurs in shared repos such as [kubernetes/kubernetes], or [kubernetes/enhancements].

This issue outlines 3 problems/requests that could help resolve those problems and make the boards much more useful. It largely boils down to: where `repo_group` is present, add filters for repo, sig/wg label, and Company.

 
---

## Problem 1 - lack of per repo visibility

**Feature Request:** On dashboards where `repo_group` is present, allow further filtering by individual repo.

SIGs have many repos and the work is delegated to subproject owners that own those repos. The current dashboards using `repo_group` do not offer a per-repo breakdown and cannot be used to evaluate the health of a partcular subproject.

**Examples:**
- [Developer Activity Counts by Repository Group] - Without the possibility of a per-repo breakdown, it's difficult to see which repos activity may have dropped.
- [Inactive Issues by SIG] - - While this gives a holestic view of the SIG, without further breakdown by repo it's not possible to see where the problem might actually exist.
- [Awaiting PRs by SIG] - Same as the above Inactive Issue board.



[Developer Activity Counts by Repository Group]: https://k8s.devstats.cncf.io/d/13/developer-activity-counts-by-repository-group?orgId=1
[Inactive Issues by SIG]: https://k8s.devstats.cncf.io/d/73/inactive-issues-by-sig?orgId=1
[Awaiting PRs by SIG]: https://k8s.devstats.cncf.io/d/70/awaiting-prs-by-sig?orgId=1

---

## Problem 2 - lack of per SIG/WG break down in shared repos

**Feature Request:** on dashboards where `repo_group` is present, allow further filtering by SIG label.

Some SIGs/WGs work almost exclusively out of shared repos such as [kubernetes/kubernetes] or [kubernetes/enhancement]; repo_group does not capture their work.

**Examples:**
- [SIG Scalability Repository Groups] - SIG Scalability is near 100% out of [kubernetes/kubernetes].
- [SIG Auth Repository Groups] - The majority of SIG Auth's work occurs in [kubernetes/kubernetes] with the repos listed here being subprojects or initatives under a working group.


[SIG Scalability Repository Groups]: https://k8s.devstats.cncf.io/d/68/repository-groups?orgId=1&var-repogroups=Not%20specified&var-repogroups=SIG%20Scalability
[SIG Auth Repository Groups]:  https://k8s.devstats.cncf.io/d/68/repository-groups?orgId=1&var-repogroups=SIG%20Scalability&var-repogroups=SIG%20Auth


---

## Problem 3 - Companies cannot reasonably measure their involvement

**Feature Request:** On dashboards where `repo_group` is present, allow further filtering by Company.

As a company trying to gauge our involvement within a particular SIG or subproject, we cannot establish what areas we are contributing to because `repo_group` does not provide enough detail (the previous two requests).

Being able to look at the areas, and check company investment helps highlight areas that need potential headcount, or internal re-alignment to ensure the upstream group/repo/subproject remains healthy.

(No examples, please see above requests examples, but think of company metric)


[kubernetes/kubernetes]: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes
[kubernetes/enhancements]: https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements

Issue.Title: [Feature Request][Kubernetes] Add additional filters to dashboards

Activities.Body:
This is a follow up from #289, #293, and #295 

Adding a filter for sig/wg labels to the [Contributions chart](https://k8s.devstats.cncf.io/d/74/contributions-chart?orgId=1) will allow SIGS and WGs that work out of shared repos to look at their metrics. With that change it should resolve all our current asks and give sig leads, subproject owners and companies the info they need 👍

Issue.Title: [feature request][kubernetes] Add wg/sig label filter to Contributions chart
